intro: Nigella arvensis, commonly known as field fennel, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its seeds, which are small and black, are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Nigella arvensis is known for its aromatic qualities and has been historically valued for its medicinal and culinary uses.
